hackathon-description-text: Hack Upstate’s mission is to unite and facilitate collaboration among the greater Upstate New York technology community. In doing so, we aim to contribute to the growth of Upstate New York’s technology sector and to create a robust network of technologists and regional technology companies.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Vice President of Digital Services, Pinckney Hugo Group

hackathon-eligibility: Anyone can participate! There is no limit on the number of members that you can have on a team.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Huge thank you to Thimble (thimble.io) and Arrow for providing these!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hardware Hack - Arduino starter kits (3x)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Visit these links for more information.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: [$100 + Udemy Credits] Best UX - Provided by ITX Corp

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hats, t-shirts, Mousepads, Game Codes (Steam and Xbox)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=402, 235 Harrison St, Syracuse, NY 13202, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: We celebrate ingenuity and creativity! Have an idea for a project that sounds crazy to tackle (especially in a 24 hour period)? Perfect.
Subjective and buzz-wordy, huh? That's what makes it fun :) We know you have something up your sleeve that's going to knock our socks off!
To what extent did your team successfully execute upon your project concept over the course of 24 hours?

You'll have 2-3 minutes for a demo to tell the judges about your project, followed by a Q/A. We're interested in the problems you solved, API's you leveraged, technologies used, and lessons learned. We recommend a quick powerpoint.
We encourage and applaud interdisciplinary projects fueled by eclectic teams with diverse backgrounds.

hackathon-description-header: Advancing Upstate New York's Technology Community
